name: Mazda MX-5
detail: Lightweight two-passenger sports car manufactured and marketed by Mazda with a front mid-engine, rear-wheel-drive layout.

name: Volkswagen Kübelwagen
detail: Light military vehicle designed by Ferdinand Porsche and built by Volkswagen during World War II for use by the German military.

name: Porsche Cayenne
detail: Luxury mid-size luxury crossover SUV that offers the best of both worlds - the style and performance of a sports car and the comfort and luxury of an SUV.

name: Vauxhall Chevette
detail: A front-engine, rear-drive subcompact manufactured and marketed by Chevrolet for model years 1976-1987 as a three-door or five-door hatchback.

name: Dymaxion car
detail: It is a streamlined, futuristic vehicle with three wheels, a periscope, and an ovoid body that reminded observers of a tadpole or a flying fish

name: Ford Crown Victoria
detail: The Crown Victoria was produced on the rear-wheel drive, body-on-frame Ford Panther platform

name: Plymouth Superbird
detail: ighly modified, short-lived version of the Plymouth Road Runner with applied graphic images as well as a distinctive horn sound both referencing the popular Looney Tunes cartoon character the Road Runner.

name: Saab 9000
detail: Although the 9000 was initially introduced as a five-door hatchback, it has evolved into a four-door notchback with a more traditional profile as well as a

name: Pontiac Sunfire
detail: The Pontiac Sunfire is a compact car by Pontiac that was introduced for the 1995 model year to replace the Sunbird. Not only was the name changed, but dramatic styling changes were included as well.

name: AMC Javelin
detail: The AMC Javelin is an American front-engine, rear-wheel-drive, two-door hardtop automobile manufactured by American Motors Corporation (AMC) across two generations

name: Jaguar X-Type
detail: Considered a large family car in Europe and a compact car in the US, the X-Type was part of the compact-executive market segment and was sold in four-door saloon and five-door estate body styles.

name: Volkswagen Phaeton
detail: It is available with Automatic transmission. Depending upon the variant and fuel type the Phaeton has a mileage of 12.8 kmpl & Ground clearance of Phaeton is 128mm.

name: Pontiac G6
detail: A mid-size car that was produced by General Motors under the Pontiac brand. It was introduced in 2004 for the 2005 model year to replace the Grand Am.

name: Ford Five Hundred
detail: A distinguishing feature of the Ford Five Hundred is its tall exterior height; at 61.5 inches tall, it was over 5 inches taller than the Ford Taurus sold alongside it. A key feature driving the use of the tall body design was the upward

name: Pontiac Solstice
detail: The Pontiac Solstice is a sports car that was produced by Pontiac. Introduced at the 2004 North American International Auto Show, the Solstice roadster

name: Fiat Tipo
detail: The Fiat Tipo Hatchback and Station Wagon engine range is built to take on everyday driving and deliver the performance you need for adventure.

name: Plymouth Reliant
detail: Boxy, underpowered and unremarkable, the Plymouth Reliant, or rather its chassis, was one of the most revolutionary cars of the early 1980s.

name: Chevrolet Chevette
detail: The Chevrolet Chevette is a front-engine, rear-drive subcompact manufactured and marketed by Chevrolet for model years 1976–1987 as a three-door or five-door

name: SEAT León
detail: The new SEAT Leon is a family car, along the same lines as a Ford Focus or Toyota Corolla, but with sporty-looking bodywork and lots of hi-tech equipment.

name: Chevrolet Corsica
detail: The Corsica was built upon the L-body platform. It shared the L-body with the 2-door Beretta, and the rebadged revival of the Pontiac Tempest which was essentially the same car, but was only sold in Canada.
